messages.message:
Good morning team :slightly_smiling_face: Despite pulling master a handful of times after the monaco PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/31370)'s been merged and recompiling my services, I'm still getting a localhost `monaco is not defined` error after logging in, and I'm unable to try and jump to other urls for local testing.
I've recompiled all services included in `ppy compile lite` locally, as docker using prebuilt, and as docker without prebuilt. I've also made sure to `make build-local` in `webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked` and use the `RELOAD=true` flag for webapp, apps-server, and server-nginx, yet I can't seem to get rid of the monaco bug. All services included in `ppy status lite` are up, and on the frontend side, I've only found `celery-webdriver-tasks` to be down, but I'm getting dependency errors trying to download necessary imports to compile this service. Does anyone know what else I should try?
I’m not sure but I know that celery-webdriver-tasks being down likely isn’t the issue. It’s always down for me too and I have no issue running locally
I also got the monaco error the first time I pulled from master today, it disappeared after I switched around to different branches and came back to master though
i've tried hard refreshing but let me switch around and back
switching around and recompiling frontend services didnt seem to do the trick, did you recompile everything?
Hmm I didn't have to recompile, I assumed it was because some of the old code was cached in the frontend
When you compare your repo to the monaco PR's, do you have the code that jessica added?
mhmm, yepp, i checked that the PR changes went through, and just checking, does hard refreshing clear the cache?
hard refreshing clears the browser's cache for a specific page and forces it to load the latest version
If you go directly to other pages, do any of them work? or is the entire site blocked for you?

i've tried jumping to pages like apps/ml-studio, but because it just brings me back to the login page since my login info isnt saved, I can't jump anywhere else and always get the monaco bug on the `https://localhost/account/login` page
Ahhh one thing I can think of is that the monaco fix wasn't applied to the login page. From the PR, I don't see a corresponding file for the login page
Hmm never mind, login works fine for me in incognito
ya, I was thinking that it might not be as tied to the specific PR, but still wasn't sure what would make this bug persist past pulling latest master and recompiling :(
just wanted to add this sc bc to me it looks slightly different than the one I got before that someone said was the monaco bug
